trans-unit.source: ACS Service Limitations
trans-unit.target: ACS Service Limitations

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: ACS Service Limitations
trans-unit.target: ACS Service Limitations

trans-unit.source: This topic explains the maximum values that <token>firstref_acs</token> allows for different aspects of the service.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains the maximum values that <token>firstref_acs</token> allows for different aspects of the service.

trans-unit.source: Google Identity Provider Support
trans-unit.target: Google Identity Provider Support

trans-unit.source: ACS namespaces can migrate their Google identity provider configurations from OpenID 2.0 to OpenID Connect.
trans-unit.target: ACS namespaces can migrate their Google identity provider configurations from OpenID 2.0 to OpenID Connect.

trans-unit.source: Migration must be completed before June 1, 2015.
trans-unit.target: Migration must be completed before June 1, 2015.

trans-unit.source: For detailed guidance, see <link xlink:href="abed9a15-8466-4c3a-80e0-8fa24a3ea0f7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Migrating ACS Namespaces to Google OpenID Connect</link>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed guidance, see <link xlink:href="abed9a15-8466-4c3a-80e0-8fa24a3ea0f7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Migrating ACS Namespaces to Google OpenID Connect</link>.

trans-unit.source: Rules Executed Eight Times per Input Token
trans-unit.target: Rules Executed Eight Times per Input Token

trans-unit.source: Whenever <token>secondref_acs</token> receives an input token for a relying party application, the <token>secondref_acs</token> rules engine executes all rules associated with that relying party application simultaneously.
trans-unit.target: Whenever <token>secondref_acs</token> receives an input token for a relying party application, the <token>secondref_acs</token> rules engine executes all rules associated with that relying party application simultaneously.

trans-unit.source: If the rules output additional claims not present in the input token, then all rules are executed again with those claims as the input values.
trans-unit.target: If the rules output additional claims not present in the input token, then all rules are executed again with those claims as the input values.

trans-unit.source: Rule execution stops when no new claims are issued after an execution completes, or eight executions have completed (whichever comes first).
trans-unit.target: Rule execution stops when no new claims are issued after an execution completes, or eight executions have completed (whichever comes first).

trans-unit.source: Management Service Limits Query Results
trans-unit.target: Management Service Limits Query Results

trans-unit.source: When using the Management Service to query rule groups for rules, the service limits the query result to no more than 100 rules.
trans-unit.target: When using the Management Service to query rule groups for rules, the service limits the query result to no more than 100 rules.

trans-unit.source: This is because the Management Service uses the Open Data (OData) protocol and returning 100 objects at a time (paging) is standard behavior for OData endpoints.
trans-unit.target: This is because the Management Service uses the Open Data (OData) protocol and returning 100 objects at a time (paging) is standard behavior for OData endpoints.

trans-unit.source: The result size for each of the <token>secondref_acs</token> entities is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The result size for each of the <token>secondref_acs</token> entities is as follows:

trans-unit.source: Rules: 100
trans-unit.target: Rules: 100

trans-unit.source: Everything else: 50
trans-unit.target: Everything else: 50

trans-unit.source: Larger result sets can only be handled by implementing paging in your Management Service client code.
trans-unit.target: Larger result sets can only be handled by implementing paging in your Management Service client code.

trans-unit.source: For pagination examples, see <externalLink><linkText>How to: Load Paged Results (WCF Data Services)</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=193452</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=193452).
trans-unit.target: For pagination examples, see <externalLink><linkText>How to: Load Paged Results (WCF Data Services)</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=193452</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=193452).

trans-unit.source: Incoming Claims Limit
trans-unit.target: Incoming Claims Limit

trans-unit.source: In order for the ACS to process and successfully issue a security token, the number of claims in the incoming token must be equal to or no greater than 80.
trans-unit.target: In order for the ACS to process and successfully issue a security token, the number of claims in the incoming token must be equal to or no greater than 80.

trans-unit.source: If the number of the incoming claims is greater than 80, the following error message is generated: <ui>The number of input claims (#) exceeds the limit (80)</ui>.
trans-unit.target: If the number of the incoming claims is greater than 80, the following error message is generated: <ui>The number of input claims (#) exceeds the limit (80)</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Token Request Rate Limit
trans-unit.target: Token Request Rate Limit

trans-unit.source: To improve <token>secondref_acs</token> availability and performance for all users, <token>secondref_acs</token> has implemented a sustained rate limit of 30 token requests per second for each namespace.
trans-unit.target: To improve <token>secondref_acs</token> availability and performance for all users, <token>secondref_acs</token> has implemented a sustained rate limit of 30 token requests per second for each namespace.

trans-unit.source: This per-namespace rate limit is measured as an average for each minute over several minutes, so it is not triggered by infrequent spikes.
trans-unit.target: This per-namespace rate limit is measured as an average for each minute over several minutes, so it is not triggered by infrequent spikes.

trans-unit.source: If a token request rate of more than 30 requests per second continues for a prolonged period, <token>secondref_acs</token> rejects excess token requests from the namespace for the duration of the interval and returns an HTTP 429 "Too many requests" error with the ACS90055 error code.
trans-unit.target: If a token request rate of more than 30 requests per second continues for a prolonged period, <token>secondref_acs</token> rejects excess token requests from the namespace for the duration of the interval and returns an HTTP 429 "Too many requests" error with the ACS90055 error code.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> also rejects token requests when <token>secondref_acs</token> resources are temporarily consumed by a high token request rate from all namespaces.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> also rejects token requests when <token>secondref_acs</token> resources are temporarily consumed by a high token request rate from all namespaces.

trans-unit.source: In this case, <token>secondref_acs</token> returns an HTTP 503 "Service unavailable" error with the ACS90046 (ACS busy) or ACS60021 (data server busy) error codes.
trans-unit.target: In this case, <token>secondref_acs</token> returns an HTTP 503 "Service unavailable" error with the ACS90046 (ACS busy) or ACS60021 (data server busy) error codes.

trans-unit.source: When you get HTTP 429 or 503 errors, retry the requests with a back-off timer, as discussed in <link xlink:href="69a16929-38b9-447f-ac88-f7a32f37e00e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Retry Guidelines</link>.
trans-unit.target: When you get HTTP 429 or 503 errors, retry the requests with a back-off timer, as discussed in <link xlink:href="69a16929-38b9-447f-ac88-f7a32f37e00e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Retry Guidelines</link>.

trans-unit.source: If the retries are not distributed over increasing time intervals, the accumulated retries are likely to exacerbate the problem and prolong the period during which token requests are rejected.
trans-unit.target: If the retries are not distributed over increasing time intervals, the accumulated retries are likely to exacerbate the problem and prolong the period during which token requests are rejected.

trans-unit.source: If you are getting recurring ACS90055-HTTP 429 errors because your namespace is exceeding the token request rate limit, consider redistributing your workload by replacing a single namespace with several smaller namespaces.
trans-unit.target: If you are getting recurring ACS90055-HTTP 429 errors because your namespace is exceeding the token request rate limit, consider redistributing your workload by replacing a single namespace with several smaller namespaces.
